content.description: The hardest most direct line in the main cave. After an initial romp up the first overhang Heart Transplant battles through a dynamic compression V7/8 boulder problem before meeting up with the L finish to the "cave route." Rumor states this route was originally climbed/equipped with a bolted-on, heart-shaped climbing hold, going at 5.12ish. Kimmo came along, removed the offending hold, sent the climb properly, and renamed the route.
content.location: Center of the cave up the cleanest swath of stone.

content.description:
The main attraction! Climb up a steepening face with powerful moves. Keep enough juice to clip the anchors!

This route splits 3/4 of the way up - the left exit feels a bit harder, and I was told the right exit was the original.
content.location: This is the center route in the steep wall with the roof above - the obvious king line.

content.description: Starts out with a tricky undercling and reach through a roof providing the crux - but save some energy for the pumpy finish as the route cuts left below the chains.
content.protection: Bolts. Fixed biners at the chains
content.location: Rightmost of three routes that ascend the more vertical section at the left side fo the main wall - to the left of the significant caves.

content.description: This one's short but stout! Get yourself up to the roof easily, and be ready to grunt a bit.
content.protection: Bolts. Fixed biners at the chains.
content.location: A short route, the last one on the right edge of the roof.

content.description: More delightful jug-thugging up and left leads you to a horizontal roof split by a diagonal crack. A wild move gets the pump up as you surmount the roof and continue to the chains.
content.protection: Bolts. Fixed biners at the chains.
content.location: Last full-length route on the right side of the significant cave.

content.description: A little boulder problem kicks this route off - stick clip recommended. Then get yourself to the beautiful smooth headwall where a line of thoughtful face climbing moves follows an orange steak to the chains.
content.location: Leftmost route on the cave wall - walk uphill in the grass about 30 feet from the Dike route. Begins below a triangular feature.

content.description: Balance on a stack of cheater stones and grab a protruding nose of rock. Kick on and get cranking! A bit of nice face climbing leads to more absurdly overhung jugs up and left all the way to the top of the wall. Stick clip recommended!
content.protection: Bolts. Fixed biners on the chains.
content.location: Right side of the main wall's amphitheater - starts on a boulder.

content.description: Head upwards through an endless series of blocky encounters followingÂ  some bright green lichen.
content.location: This route is on a narrow ledge just at the top of a fixed line on the right side of cave wall. Scramble down from the Shorty route and ascend the fixed line. A belay bolt for this route is at waist height.

content.description: A more vertical start with some engaging flakes leads to a a tougher roof encounter. Good warmup for the harder routes on this wall.
content.protection: Bolts. Fixed biners at the anchor.
content.location: Middle of three routes that climb a more vertical section of the main wall, to the left of the significant overhangs.

content.description:
Start with a bolt on a slab and then head left through some pretty poor rock. The bolt spacing, ledges, and traverse here make for some pretty awful fall potential in a few spots. Persevere and you'll come to one of the most comical bits of route engineering I've ever seen: a block epoxied into place and backed up with a bolted on BD wired nut!

Luckily, things do improve as you ascend. A tricky move left on blank rock ups the quality, and then finish up on some almost traditional climbing moves up a steep, high-quality crack to the chains.
content.location:
This route is on a narrow ledge on the right side of cave wall. Scramble down from the Shorty route and ascend the fixed line. Traverse the ledge to the right and belay on a platform below a slab that contains the first bolt.

Rightmost climb on Cave Wall.

content.description: Start by following four bolts sharply to the left on blocky, overhanging rock. Pull onto the less-steep terrain and enjoy a fun grab-bag of different styles to the top. Don't miss the awesome quartz dike that splits the wall horizontally!
content.location: Left edge of the main cave wall, just where the rocky scree platform fades into grass.

content.description: Get yourself up behind a hanging blade of rock... then figure out how to get onto and above it!
content.location: Leftmost route in the cave on the main wall. Distinctive hanging blade about 15-20 feet up.
